title: drupal trans filter
description: This filter (alternatively, t) will run the variable through the Drupal t() function, which will return a translated string. This filter should be used for any interface strings manually placed in the template that will appear for users.

title: drupal placeholder filter
description: This filter escapes content to HTML and formats it using drupal_placeholder(), which makes it display as emphasized text.

title: drupal clean_class filter
description: This filter prepares a string for use as a valid HTML class name. See Html::getClass()

title: drupal clean_id filter
description: This filter prepares a string for use as a valid HTML ID. See Html::getId()

title: drupal format_date filter
description: This filter formats a date using the Drupal date format. See format_date()

title: drupal safe_join filter
description: This filter joins a list of strings together with a separator. See safe_join()

title: drupal without filter
description: This filter removes a key from an array. See without()
